title: Mountain Trekking in the Atlas Mountains
description: Join us for a challenging mountain trek through the stunning Atlas Mountains in Morocco...

notices.name: Altitude sickness is a risk at high elevations.
The trek can be physically demanding.

take_into_account.name: Bring warm clothing as temperatures can drop significantly at high elevations.
Bring sunscreen and a hat to protect from the sun.

guide.name: John Smith
guide.bio: I am an experienced mountain guide with over 10 years...

destination.label: Mount Toubkal
destination.description: Mount Toubkal is the highest peak in the Atlas Mountains...

steps.label: Day 1: Marrakesh to Imlil
steps.description: On the first day, we will drive from Marrakesh to Imlil, a small village at the base of Mount Toubkal. We will spend the night in a traditional Moroccan guesthouse in Imlil.

steps.label: Day 2: Imlil to Toubkal Base Camp
steps.description: On the second day, we will begin our hike to Toubkal Base Camp. The hike takes about 6 hours and passes through small villages and beautiful landscapes. We will spend the night in a tent at the base camp.

steps.label: Day 3: Toubkal Base Camp to Summit and back to Imlil
steps.description: On the third day, we will wake up early to begin our ascent to the summit of Mount Toubkal. The hike to the summit takes about 4-5 hours. We will enjoy the breathtaking views from the summit before descending back to Toubkal Base Camp. In the afternoon, we will hike back to Imlil and spend the night in a guesthouse.

steps.label: Day 4: Imlil to Marrakesh
steps.description: On the fourth and final day, we will drive back to Marrakesh. The drive takes about 2 hours. The trip ends upon arrival in Marrakesh.

meetingPoint.instructions: We will meet at the main entrance...

user_reviews.comment: This trekking experience was unforgettable! The guide was knowledgeable and the scenery was breathtaking. Highly recommend!
Great experience overall. The food could have been better, but the trek itself was amazing!
Absolutely loved it! The guide, the trek, the landscapes â€“ everything was top-notch!
